definition: to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: Studies the intelligent spot, do not have a joke backfire.
sentences.chinese: 学聪明点吧，不要自讨没趣。

sentences.english: Can I please go to work and humiliate myself now?
sentences.chinese: 我能去上班顺便自讨没趣了吗？

sentences.english: I went to the General office, and ate dirt.
sentences.chinese: 我到总办事处去，结果自讨没趣。

sentences.english: If that person can't figure out who are you, aren't you just asking for trouble?
sentences.chinese: 要是人家想不出或猜不着你是谁，岂非自讨没趣？

sentences.english: She know how to score off people who ask difficult question.
sentences.chinese: 她很会让那些给她出难题的人自讨没趣。

definition: to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond
variant of 不答理[bu4 da1 li3]
to acknowledge/to respond/to answer/to pay attention/to heed/to deal with
not to pay attention to/to leave sth as it is/to ignore
to look displeased/to not be afraid of hurting sb's feelings/to put aside one's pride
to storm off in a huff (idiom)
